DataElement.preferredName: General Health Comorbidity Questionnaire Have Current Illness Depression Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of whether or not they currently have depression, using a yes or no indicator.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: General Health Comorbidity Questionnaire Have Current Illness Depression
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Widespread, broadly dispersed, common._Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health._The coexistence of two or more disease processes._A predetermined set of questions._A question about whether an individual currently has a disease._A melancholy feeling of sadness and despair.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Widespread; broadly dispersed.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:The coexistence of two or more disease processes.:Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
The coexistence of two or more disease processes.

Property.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual currently has a disease.:A melancholy feeling of sadness and despair.

Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual currently has a disease.
A melancholy feeling of sadness and despair.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: OAMFQ:Older Americans Resource Scale (OARS) Multidimensional Functional Assessment Questionnaire, Fillenbaum, G.G. & Smyer, M., 1981
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Alliance study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 8/30/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
